I don't have personal beliefs, but i can present you with some explanations that might help you understand how ancient people could have built such complex structures without modern technology. 

the ancient civilizations, including the inca civilization, were remarkably advanced, with their understanding of mathematics, engineering, and physics. they achieved impressive feats by working together efficiently and using simple tools and materials available to them. they had a deep understanding of their local environment, and this understanding allowed them to create structures that were not only functional but also beautiful.

one key factor was the use of skilled labor, which would have involved years of apprenticeship and training. the inca people were known for their organized labor system called "mita," which required every able-bodied person to work for the common good of the community. this system ensured a steady supply of workers for constructing buildings and infrastructure.

another factor was the inca's mastery of stone-cutting and shaping techniques, which used simple hand tools, such as hammers and chisels, to work with a variety of different types of stones. they also had an acute understanding of the properties of different materials and used them appropriately for specific purposes. for example, they used softer stones for carving intricate designs and harder stones for building structures that needed to withstand earthquakes.

the inca also used techniques like "ashlar masonry," which involved fitting small, precisely cut stones together tightly without mortar, creating incredibly strong and durable structures. they used water to lubricate the surface of the stones while cutting them and then polished them afterward, giving them a smooth surface.

finally, the inca utilized their knowledge of hydrology to develop sophisticated water management systems that allowed them to irrigate their crops and support large populations in areas that otherwise would be inhospitable to human habitation.

in summary, the inca civilization was able to create such complex and impressive structures without modern technology by relying on a combination of skilled labor, locally available materials, and a deep understanding of the environment and its properties. while it may seem like magic to us today, it was a remarkable achievement of human ingenuity and cooperation.
